newsitem.title: KAZAKHSTAN: Kazakhs to sell 60 pct of Embamunaigaz oil company.
newsitem.headline: Kazakhs to sell 60 pct of Embamunaigaz oil company.

text.p: The Kazakh government announced on Tuesday a tender for a 60 percent stake in the former Soviet republic's fourth largest oil producer, Embamunaigaz.
The government says Embamunaigaz, located in northwest Kazakhstan, is sitting on 65.7 million tonnes of oil reserves.
The finance ministry's state property department told Reuters bids from foreigners and domestic investors would be accepted until April 29.
"But if we receive bids from serious investors before the expiry of the official deadline, we will not wait until April 29 and hold the tender earlier," a department official told Reuters.
Each investor must make a refundable deposit equivalent to $500,000 to take part in the tender.
An official statement obtained by Reuters said investors wanting to compete in the tender must offer an investment programme along with social and environment protection programmes.
Participants in the tender will also have to outline future payments to the Kazakh budget, including taxes, royalties and bonuses.
The tender is part of a fast-track sell-off of Kazakh energy enterprises -- unprecedented for an ex-Soviet state -- aimed at filling the cash-strapped government's coffers.
Embamunaigaz's production totalled 1.74 million tonnes last year.

Analysts at investment company Global Kazkommerts Securities Inc said in a recent report that the enterprise is Kazakhstan's fourth largest oil producer, accounting for approximately 10 percent of Kazakhstan's output.
The government currently holds an 85 percent stake in the company, 10 percent of shares are owned by the workforce and the remaining five percent is held by investment funds.

After the tender the government plans to offer part of its remaining stake in Embamunaigaz -- alongside shares in other energy concerns -- to portfolio investors on the country's nascent stock market, which plans to start trading by the end of the year.
